intro: Senecio sordidus, commonly known as the dirty senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, powdery coating, giving it a dusty appearance. Senecio sordidus produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators.
